alert.note: Alert for Northern Horry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 11:50AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Robeson, western Columbus and north central Horry Counties through 1215 PM EDT... At 1150 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Tabor City, or 16 miles southwest of Whiteville, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Whiteville, Tabor City, Loris, Chadbourn, Mollie, Sidney, Southeastern Community College, Clarendon, Williams, Evergreen, Green Sea, Brunswick, Cerro Gordo, and Columbus Regional Healthcare System. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
